## Brief introduction

This tutorial aims at describing the different features of the R package `bioRgeo`. The main purpose of the `bioRgeo`'s package is to propose a transparent methodological framework to compare bioregionalization methods. Below is the typical flow chart of bioregions' identification from a site-species bipartite network or co-occurence matrix with `bioRgeo` (Figure 1). This workflow can be divided into four main steps:

1. Data preprocessing (matrix or network formats)
2. Compute similarity/distance metrics between sites based on species composition (optional).
3. Run the different algorithms to identify different set of bioregions.
4. Evaluation and visualization of the results.
